author: Soulskill
title: Lord British Claims He Owns the Moonspan classvballoonmarquee rd5spanComments:spana href144aspan

sent.goldlabel: Richard Garriotts daimon lunar territory and reactions
sent.sent: An anonymous reader writes Following the recent discovery of Richard Garriotts old moon rover the man known as Lord British has laid claim to his own lunar territory.

sent.goldlabel: Richard Garriotts daimon lunar territory and reactions
sent.sent: Moon dwellers all hail your new overlord

sent.goldlabel: Richard Garriotts daimon lunar territory and reactions
sent.sent: So if another probe lands in the vicinity or roves its away across the supposed territory would Lord British then have grounds to sue for ruining the property values?

sent.goldlabel: Richard Garriotts daimon lunar territory and reactions
sent.sent: Good Lord man look at what youve done

sent.goldlabel: Richard Garriotts daimon lunar territory and reactions
sent.sent: All those tracks ruin the pristine scenery

sent.goldlabel: Richard Garriotts daimon lunar territory and reactions
sent.sent: Reminds me of the short story by Robert Heinlein The Man Who Sold the Moon in 1950 and appeared later in different collections.

sent.goldlabel: Richard Garriotts daimon lunar territory and reactions
sent.sent: maybe he should be charged a land tax say 5 cents to every person in the world.

sent.goldlabel: Richard Garriotts daimon lunar territory and reactions
sent.sent: Simple.

sent.goldlabel: Richard Garriotts daimon lunar territory and reactions
sent.sent: We declare that as he now has his own land he and that land is a country.

sent.goldlabel: Richard Garriotts daimon lunar territory and reactions
sent.sent: And that that country just declared war upon us.*BOOOM*Done.

sent.goldlabel: Richard Garriotts daimon lunar territory and reactions

sent.goldlabel: OFFTOPIC
sent.sent: *BOOOM* adequately describes what my head did while trying to parse your post

sent.goldlabel: Moon Treaty and outer space treaty
sent.sent: Article 11 paragraph 2 of the Moon Treaty states:

sent.goldlabel: Moon Treaty and outer space treaty
sent.sent: The moon is not subject to national appropriation by any claim of

sent.goldlabel: Moon Treaty and outer space treaty
sent.sent: sovereignty by means of use or occupation or by any other means.

sent.goldlabel: Moon Treaty and outer space treaty
sent.sent: Of course England hasnt signed or ratified the Moon Treaty so it all kinda depends on the international reaction whether or not his claim is valid.

sent.goldlabel: ownership of the moon and space law
sent.sent: If the US manages to emplace enough population to let Luna qualify for immediate statehood ahead of anyone else occupying the land Im not sure theres anything in the UN treaty excluding doing it.

sent.goldlabel: ownership of the moon and space law
sent.sent: Claiming it as an annexed territory is one thing having its permanent inhabitants petition for statehood is constitutionally very much another.

sent.goldlabel: ownership of the moon and space law
sent.sent: http:www.lunarembassy.comThe lunar embassy has been selling land on the moon for years.

sent.goldlabel: ownership of the moon and space law
sent.sent: It may already be owned.

sent.goldlabel: ownership of the moon and space law
sent.sent: Garriott may or may not own a legal title to Lunokhod it is by no means a given that the auction sale was a legitimate title but there is no way buying Lunokhod gives him any ownership rights to any piece of the Moon however small.From http:www.space.comnewssovietmoonroverspacelaw100322.html space.com: Validity of ownership?

sent.goldlabel: ownership of the moon and space law
sent.sent: Enter space lawyer Joanne Irene Gabrynowicz.

sent.goldlabel: ownership of the moon and space law
sent.sent: She is Director of the National Center for Remote Sensing Air and Space Law and Research Professor of Law at the University of Mississippi.

sent.goldlabel: ownership of the moon and space law
sent.sent: The soundness of a property right depends in large part on the integrity of the documents that memorialize the right Gabrynowicz told SPACE.com via email.

sent.goldlabel: ownership of the moon and space law
sent.sent: This is why property buyers conduct title searches before buying property.

sent.goldlabel: ownership of the moon and space law
sent.sent: They want to be sure that the title is good.

sent.goldlabel: ownership of the moon and space law
sent.sent: Gabrynowicz said that without reading the papers or knowing how they were processed and by whom she cant speak to the validity of the ownership of a space object purchased at auction.

sent.goldlabel: ownership of the moon and space law
sent.sent: However a contention that buying a space object that landed on the lunar surface from a sovereign nation gives rise to a property right to the territory under it is wrong Gabrynowicz said.

sent.goldlabel: Moon Treaty and outer space treaty
sent.sent: Gabrynowicz said that StatesParties to the Outer Space Treaty of 1966 cannot acquire lunar territory by landing an object on the moon.

sent.goldlabel: Moon Treaty and outer space treaty
sent.sent: The USSR was and Russia is a party to the Outer Space Treaty she added.

sent.goldlabel: Moon Treaty and outer space treaty
sent.sent: It did not acquire the territory under the object when it landed.

sent.goldlabel: ownership of the moon and space law
sent.sent: One cannot sell what one does not own.

sent.goldlabel: ownership of the moon and space law
sent.sent: Since USSRRussia did not have a property right to the territory under the landed object there was nothing to sell.

sent.goldlabel: ownership of the moon and space law
sent.sent: Joanne Irene Gabrynowicz.... Space Lawyer

sent.goldlabel: ownership of the moon and space law
sent.sent: Didnt some company in Neveda try selling titlesdeeds to the Moon years back?

sent.goldlabel: ownership of the moon and space law
sent.sent: You know I dont think any of those titlesdeeds are going to be worth anything.

sent.goldlabel: ownership of the moon and space law
sent.sent: I think true ownership will be when someone actually takes up residence or makes use of a given property on the Moon.

sent.goldlabel: ownership of the moon and space law
sent.sent: No pointing and saying Hey that there its mine

sent.goldlabel: ownership of the moon and space law
sent.sent: Im not a lawyer but common sense sort of dictates this doesnt it?

sent.goldlabel: ownership of the moon and space law
sent.sent: I mean under whose authority will those titlesdeeds be enforced?

sent.goldlabel: ownership of the moon and space law
sent.sent: Were all here back on Earth afterall.

sent.goldlabel: ownership of the moon and space law
sent.sent: Now theres a job title with a Bmovie behind it...

sent.goldlabel: ownership of the moon and space law
sent.sent: So at best he might have an implicit easement wikipedia.org that lets him park his stuff on the surface of the Moon which is otherwise public property Im thinking of this type wikipedia.org.At worst he might owe a few decades of parking fees for leaving his stuff unattended on the commons.

sent.goldlabel: ownership of the moon and space law
sent.sent: Most people around here are taking Garriotts bait and are picking apart the legal ramifications of his rover ownership but its much simpler than that.

sent.goldlabel: ownership of the moon and space law
sent.sent: You own something if you can defend it.

sent.goldlabel: ownership of the moon and space law
sent.sent: I.e. you have an army.

sent.goldlabel: ownership of the moon and space law
sent.sent: Treaties are meaningless outside the context of force.

sent.goldlabel: ownership of the moon and space law
sent.sent: Ever wonder why making someone follow a contract is called enforcement?

sent.goldlabel: ownership of the moon and space law
sent.sent: And because R.A.H.

sent.goldlabel: ownership of the moon and space law
sent.sent: is taken as Gospel around here: the moon dwellers didnt gain sovereignty until they showed that they could pummel the bejeezus out of Earth.

sent.goldlabel: ownership of the moon and space law
sent.sent: It turns out that it actually works that way in real life.

children.author: nomorecwrd
children.title: The moon is owned by a chilean Period

sent.goldlabel: ownership of the moon and space law
sent.sent: Here is the proof

sent.goldlabel: ownership of the moon and space law
sent.sent: in English wikipedia.org and Spanish more complete wikipedia.org

sent.goldlabel: ownership of the moon and space law
sent.sent: Dont argue with me about Wikipedia not being the total truth.

sent.goldlabel: START
sent.sent: Wow.

sent.goldlabel: the original article
sent.sent: No fact checking.

sent.goldlabel: the original article
sent.sent: Typical overthetopcantgetthefactsright journalism.

sent.goldlabel: the original article
sent.sent: The article tries to paint Lord British as laying claim to the entire moon in the title when in reality hes only even trying to claim at least the land on which the rover sits and at most the land the rover crossed before it laid to rest.The lawyer who was quoted when asked if he really owned the lander is quite frankly covering her ass as any good lawyer would do when asked a question like that.

sent.goldlabel: the original article
sent.sent: What she says that she cant determine if he owns it or not without seeing the title is true.

sent.goldlabel: ownership of the moon and space law
sent.sent: Any good lawyer would say the same thing if you called them to ask if you owned your house.

sent.goldlabel: ownership of the moon and space law
sent.sent: Theyre not going to assume you do even if you have been living there for the last 10 years.

sent.goldlabel: Richard Garriotts daimon lunar territory and reactions
sent.sent: That would be borderline malpractice.What Gariott is doing is in fact not nearly as crazy as it sounds.

sent.goldlabel: Moon Treaty and outer space treaty
sent.sent: Since virtually every spacefaring nation gave up their rights to the moon in the Outer Space Treaty any claims to the moon by right of discovery that could have been made by the US or Russia as USSRs successor state are void under international law.

sent.goldlabel: Moon Treaty and outer space treaty
sent.sent: The treaty however does not contemplate private ownership of the moon.

sent.goldlabel: ownership of the moon and space law
sent.sent: Gariott actually has a number of very very reasonable legal arguments that he owns a part of the moon.

sent.goldlabel: ownership of the moon and space law
sent.sent: Yes it does sound very strange to a lay person that he might have a right of discovery some land on the moon since in the lay sense he did obviously not discover the moon.

sent.goldlabel: ownership of the moon and space law
sent.sent: That said legally its not unreasonable to say that he might.

sent.goldlabel: ownership of the moon and space law
sent.sent: Nor is it unreasonable to say that he might gain the land through simply owning the rover on it long enough.While the auction could not and did not sell him the land this does not mean he cant own it.

sent.goldlabel: ownership of the moon and space law
sent.sent: If noone owns the land then there are a number of legal ways to acquire it as Ive briefly discussed above.The article frankly was clearly written by someone with no understanding of the legal circumstances around the matter.

children.author: Anonymous9
children.title: I hope hes just joking around

sent.goldlabel: ownership of the moon and space law
sent.sent: Last time I heard there was an international treaty or something preventing countries from owning the moon or the rest of the solar system for that matter.Lord British aka Richard Garriot is a citizen of one of those signatory countries and I believe that also prevents him from laying claim.On top of that the little understanding I have of settler or homesteading laws require that the person be on that land and he has never been to the moon.Trying to claim that you own the land under or near your 2nd hand space junk is kind of like claiming you own the land around a rock you threw into the fog.Now as nobody has made any attempts at recovery of the lander I suspect international law allows a salvager to claim it if they salvage it.

sent.goldlabel: ownership of the moon and space law
sent.sent: Not likely to happen anytime soon.

sent.goldlabel: ownership of the moon and space law
sent.sent: Of course IANAL and this is all just my opinion based on the few things Ive read on some of these laws but still lets get some sense in here.Besides everyone knows that the best lunar property is on the darkside.

children.author: Anonymous14
children.title: The Case for Lunar Property Rights

sent.goldlabel: Space race between the US and USSR
sent.sent: According to an article in Popular Mechanics popularmechanics.com from the June 2008 issue:With the space race in full flower though the real worry was national sovereignty.

sent.goldlabel: Space race between the US and USSR
sent.sent: Both the United States and the Soviet Union wanted to reach the moon first but in fact each was more worried about what would happen if they arrived second.

sent.goldlabel: Moon Treaty and outer space treaty
sent.sent: Fears that the competition might trigger World War III led to the 1967 Outer Space Treaty which was eventually ratified by 62 countries.

sent.goldlabel: Moon Treaty and outer space treaty
sent.sent: According to article II of the treaty Outer Space including the moon and other celestial bodies is not subject to national appropriation by claim of sovereignty by means of use or occupation or by any other means.

sent.goldlabel: Moon Treaty and outer space treaty
sent.sent: Ideally title would be recognized by an international agreement that all nations would endorse.

sent.goldlabel: Moon Treaty and outer space treaty
sent.sent: The 1979 Moon Treaty was a flop but theres no reason the space powers couldnt agree on a new treaty that recognizes property rights and encourages investment.

sent.goldlabel: Moon Treaty and outer space treaty
sent.sent: After all the international climate has warmed to property rights and capitalism over the past 30 years.

sent.goldlabel: ownership of the moon and space law
sent.sent: In 1967 I bought a square inch of the Moon for 1 from a street vendor in San Francisco and I have the deed to prove it.

sent.goldlabel: OFFTOPIC
sent.sent: The moon already has a king.

sent.goldlabel: OFFTOPIC
sent.sent: ... now get off my lawn...

children.author: hobbes64
children.title: He needs to move there to claim it

sent.goldlabel: ownership of the moon and space law
sent.sent: It is possible that someday a group of private super rich citizens or a corporation will make some spaceships and fly to the moon build a lunar base there and live there.

sent.goldlabel: ownership of the moon and space law
sent.sent: It is possible for them to do it long before a government does it.

sent.goldlabel: ownership of the moon and space law
sent.sent: That would be really interesting because they could reasonably claim the moon as theirs.

sent.goldlabel: ownership of the moon and space law
sent.sent: The response of various countries to this claim would be even more interesting.

sent.goldlabel: ownership of the moon and space law
sent.sent: Ill bet there would be a lot more interest in going to the moon right away to move out those squatters.

sent.sent: FTFA:  Last week NASAs Lunar Reconnaissance Orbiter found Lunokhod 2 sitting clearly on the planets surface.

sent.sent: First Pluto ceases to be a planet...  Now the Moon is no longer a moon but a planet...  What is this solar system coming to?

sent.goldlabel: Richard Garriotts daimon lunar territory and reactions
sent.sent: They launched two that mounted retro reflectors for laser ranging experiments which my wife does on a regular basis Apache Point Observatorys Dr. Russet McMillan as featured on Mythbusters and they cant hit one of the LKs.

sent.sent: The three Apollo reflectors are fine just one of the LKs.
